1.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
1.str2: From dia and sozo; to save thoroughly, i.e. to cure, preserve, rescue, etc.

1.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
1.str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An island. Probably from the base of naus; an island.

1.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
1.str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Melita, now Malta. Of uncertain origin; Melita, an island in the Mediterranean.

2.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A foreigner, one who speaks neither Greek nor Latin; as adj: foreign. Of uncertain derivation; a foreigner.

2.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
2.str2: From para and echo; to hold near, i.e. Present, afford, exhibit, furnish occasion.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
2.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
2.str2: (a) gen: I obtain, (b) absol: I chance, happen; ordinary, everyday, it may chance, perhaps.
Love of mankind, benevolence. From the same as philanthropos; fondness of mankind, i.e. Benevolence.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
2.str2: To kindle, light. A primary verb; properly, to fasten to, i.e. to set on fire.
A fire, pile of burning fuel. From pur; a fire.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
2.str2: (a) I take to myself, (b) I take aside, (c) I welcome. From pros and lambano; to take to oneself, i.e. Use, lead, admit.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
2.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Rain. From a primary huo; rain, especially a shower.

3.str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
3.str2: To roll or gather together. From sun and strepho; to twist together, i.e. Collect.

3.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
3.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.
A dry stick for burning. Neuter of a presumed derivative of phrugo; something desiccated, i.e. A dry twig.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
3.str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fire, pile of burning fuel. From pur; a fire.
A serpent, snake, viper. Of uncertain origin; an adder or other poisonous snake.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
3.str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Heat. From the base of theros; warmth.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
3.str2: To lay hold of, fasten on to, seize, attack. From kata and haptomai; to seize upon.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
3.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

4.str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A foreigner, one who speaks neither Greek nor Latin; as adj: foreign. Of uncertain derivation; a foreigner.

4.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
4.str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Properly: a wild beast, hence: any animal; met: a brute. Diminutive from the same as thera; a dangerous animal.

4.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Accusative Neuter Singular
4.str2: To hang, hang up, suspend; mid: To be hanging, hang. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to hang.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

4.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A hand.

4.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
4.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

4.parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
4.str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
Wholly, entirely, in every way, by all means, certainly. Adverb from pas; entirely; specially, at all events, in no event.
This; he, she, it.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

4.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A murderer.

4.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
4.str2: Who, which, what, that.

4.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
4.str2: From dia and sozo; to save thoroughly, i.e. to cure, preserve, rescue, etc.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
Probably from deiknuo; right, i.e. Justice.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

4.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: To allow, permit, let alone, leave. Of uncertain affinity; to let be, i.e. Permit or leave alone.
To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.

5.str2: A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.

5.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular

Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.

5.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.

6.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
6.str2: To expect, wait for, await, think, anticipate. From pros and dokeuo; to anticipate; by implication, to await.

6.parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive

Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Suddenly. Adverb from aphanes; unawares, i.e. Unexpectedly.
To fall down, fall prostrate. From kata and pipto; to fall down.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

6.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
6.str2: To expect, wait for, await, think, anticipate. From pros and dokeuo; to anticipate; by implication, to await.

On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
And, even, also, namely.

6.str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

31.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
31.str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
